subject: Re: [junit] Re: Asserting Equality Of Collection Elements
msgSnippet: ... Careful: this only checks subcollection . You d have to do it in each direction *and* check size *and* check elements appearing multiple times, to be
messageBody:
> Thanks for the info. Actually, by the time I read your reply I had
> already written something similar to the code you directed me to. I
> looped through one collection and then determined if each item in it
> was in the other collection using the "contains" method. Sounds like
> JUnit could use another overloaded version of assertEquals.

Careful: this only checks "subcollection". You'd have to do it in each
direction *and* check size *and* check elements appearing multiple times, to
be sure.

--
